docs.title: Welcome to Motify Docs
docs.text: Motify is a modern, open-source Spotify music downloader and manager with a beautiful GUI, advanced playlist features, and high-quality audio support.

docs.title: 🚀 What Makes Motify Special?
docs.text:
• Modern, intuitive interface with dark mode and custom theming
  • Playlist management and download queue
  • Lyrics integration and download history
  • Fast, reliable, and open-source

docs.title: 💡 Why use Motify?
docs.text: Motify is designed for music lovers who want a seamless, powerful, and beautiful way to manage and download their Spotify music collections. Whether you're a casual listener or a power user, Motify has you covered.

docs.text:
• Music Download: Download high-quality audio from Spotify.
  • Playlist Management: Organize and download entire playlists with ease.
  • User Interface: Modern, responsive design for a seamless experience.
  • Advanced Features: Lyrics integration, download history, and more.

docs.title: Basic Usage
docs.text:
from motify import Motify

# Initialize Motify
motify = Motify()

# Download a track
motify.download_track("track_id")

docs.title: Advanced Configuration
docs.text:
from motify import Motify, Config

# Custom configuration
config = Config(
    output_dir="custom/path",
    quality="high"
)

# Initialize with custom config
motify = Motify(config)

docs.title: Contributing to Motify
docs.text: We welcome contributions! Here's how to get started:

docs.title: Setting Up
docs.text:
1. Fork the repo and clone your fork
  2. Install Python 3.10+
  3. Install dependencies: 
    pip install -r requirements.txt
  4. (Optional) Set up a virtual environment

docs.title: Coding Standards
docs.text:
• Follow PEP8 for Python code
  • Write clear, concise commit messages
  • Add docstrings and comments

docs.title: Submitting Pull Requests
docs.text:
• Create a new branch for your feature or fix
  • Ensure all tests pass
  • Open a pull request with a clear description

docs.title: Getting Help
docs.text:
• Open an issue on GitHub
  • Join our Discord

docs.title: Development Process
docs.text:
We use GitHub to host code, to track issues and feature requests, as well as accept pull requests.

  1. Fork the repo and create your branch from main
  2. If you've added code that should be tested, add tests
  3. If you've changed APIs, update the documentation
  4. Ensure the test suite passes
  5. Make sure your code lints
  6. Issue that pull request!

docs.title: Pull Request Process
docs.text:
1. Update the README.md with details of changes if needed
  2. Update the docs/ with any new documentation
  3. The PR will be merged once you have the sign-off

docs.title: Any contributions you make will be under the MIT Software License
docs.text: In short, when you submit code changes, your submissions are understood to be under the same MIT License that covers the project. Feel free to contact the maintainers if that's a concern.

docs.title: Report bugs using GitHub's [issue tracker]
docs.text: We use GitHub issues to track public bugs. Report a bug by opening a new issue!

docs.title: Write bug reports with detail, background, and sample code
docs.text:
Great Bug Reports tend to have:

  • A quick summary and/or background
  • Steps to reproduce
  • What you expected would happen
  • What actually happens
  • Notes (possibly including why you think this might be happening)

docs.title: Use a Consistent Coding Style
docs.text:
• 4 spaces for indentation rather than tabs
  • 80 character line length
  • Run pylint over your code

docs.title: License
docs.text: By contributing, you agree that your contributions will be licensed under its MIT License.

docs.title: Installation Guide
docs.text: Motify supports Windows, macOS, Linux, and Docker. Follow the steps below for your platform.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Python 3.10+
  • Internet connection
  • Spotify account

docs.title: Windows
docs.text:
1. Download and install Python 3.10+
  2. Open Command Prompt and run: 
    pip install motify-music
  3. Launch Motify: 
    motify

docs.title: macOS
docs.text:
1. Install Homebrew (if not installed)
  2. Install Python 3.10+: 
    brew install python@3.10
  3. Install Motify: 
    pip3 install motify-music
  4. Launch Motify: 
    motify

docs.title: Linux
docs.text:
1. Install Python 3.10+ using your package manager
  2. Install Motify: 
    pip3 install motify-music
  3. Launch Motify: 
    motify

docs.title: Docker
docs.text:
1. Pull the image: 
    docker pull mosh3eb/motify
  2. Run the container: 
    docker run -it --rm mosh3eb/motify

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text: • If you encounter issues, see Troubleshooting & FAQ or open a GitHub Issue.

docs.title: Development Installation
docs.text:
For developers who want to contribute to Motify:

  1. Clone the repository: 

    git clone https://github.com/mosh3eb/motify.git
cd motify

  2. Create a virtual environment: 

    python -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate  # Linux/macOS
venv\Scripts\activate     # Windows

  3. Install development dependencies: 

    pip install -e ".[dev]"

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
After installation, you need to configure Motify:

  1. Run Motify for the first time: 

    motify

  2. Follow the setup wizard to:

  3. Configure Spotify credentials
  4. Set download location
  5. Choose default settings

docs.title: Frequently Asked Questions
docs.text:
Q: Is Motify legal? A: Motify is intended for personal use and requires a valid Spotify account. Please respect Spotify's terms of service.

Q: Where are my downloads saved? A: By default, in your user's Music directory. You can change this in settings or config.

Q: How do I get help? A: Visit GitHub Issues or join our Discord.

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text: Motify provides a flexible configuration system that allows you to customize various aspects of the application.

docs.title: Configuration File
docs.text:
The configuration is stored in app_config.json in your home directory:

{
    "spotify": {
        "client_id": "your_client_id",
        "client_secret": "your_client_secret",
        "redirect_uri": "http://localhost:8888/callback"
    },
    "download": {
        "quality": "best",
        "format": "mp3",
        "path": "~/Music/Motify",
        "naming": "{artist} - {title}"
    },
    "interface": {
        "theme": "dark",
        "language": "en",
        "notifications": true
    }
}

docs.title: Spotify Settings
docs.text: Option Type Description client_id string Your Spotify API client ID client_secret string Your Spotify API client secret redirect_uri string OAuth redirect URI

docs.title: Download Settings
docs.text: Option Type Description quality string Audio quality (best, high, medium, low) format string Audio format (mp3, m4a, flac) path string Download directory path naming string File naming pattern

docs.title: Interface Settings
docs.text: Option Type Description theme string UI theme (dark, light) language string Interface language notifications boolean Enable/disable notifications

docs.title: Loading Configuration
docs.text:
from motify_music import Config

# Load configuration
config = Config()

# Get specific setting
download_path = config.get("download.path")

# Update setting
config.set("download.quality", "high")

docs.title: Default Configuration
docs.text:
# Get default configuration
defaults = config.get_defaults()

# Reset to defaults
config.reset_to_defaults()

docs.title: Environment Variables
docs.text:
You can override configuration using environment variables:

export MOTIFY_SPOTIFY_CLIENT_ID="your_client_id"
export MOTIFY_DOWNLOAD_PATH="~/Custom/Music"

docs.title: File-based Configuration
docs.text:
# Save configuration
config.save()

# Load configuration
config.load()

# Check if configuration exists
if config.exists():
    # Load existing config
    config.load()
else:
    # Create new config
    config.create_default()

docs.title: Runtime Configuration
docs.text:
# Update multiple settings
config.update({
    "download.quality": "high",
    "interface.theme": "dark"
})

# Get all settings
all_settings = config.get_all()

# Validate configuration
config.validate()

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
1. Keep sensitive data (API keys) secure

docs.text:

docs.title: Download History
docs.text: Motify keeps track of your download history, providing detailed statistics and insights about your music collection.

docs.title: History Tracking
docs.text:
• Track all downloaded tracks
  • Record download dates and times
  • Store download quality and format
  • Track download success/failure

docs.title: Statistics
docs.text:
• Total downloads
  • Download success rate
  • Storage usage
  • Popular artists and genres
  • Download trends over time

docs.title: History Management
docs.text:
• Search through download history
  • Filter by date, artist, or album
  • Export history data
  • Clear history entries

docs.title: Viewing History
docs.text:
from motify_music import HistoryService

# Initialize service
history = HistoryService()

# Get all download history
downloads = history.get_all_downloads()

# Get downloads by date range
recent_downloads = history.get_downloads_by_date(
    start_date="2024-01-01",
    end_date="2024-03-20"
)

docs.title: Statistics
docs.text:
# Get download statistics
stats = history.get_statistics()

# Get popular artists
top_artists = history.get_top_artists(limit=10)

# Get storage usage
storage = history.get_storage_usage()

docs.title: Lyrics Support
docs.text: Motify provides comprehensive lyrics support, allowing you to view and save lyrics for your favorite songs.

docs.title: Lyrics Display
docs.text:
• Real-time lyrics display
  • Synchronized with music playback
  • Multiple language support
  • Timestamp support

docs.title: Lyrics Management
docs.text:
• Save lyrics with downloaded tracks
  • Search lyrics database
  • Edit and update lyrics
  • Export lyrics in various formats

docs.title: Integration
docs.text:
• Automatic lyrics fetching
  • Manual lyrics search
  • Lyrics editing interface
  • Batch lyrics processing

docs.title: Fetching Lyrics
docs.text:
from motify_music import LyricsService

# Initialize service
lyrics = LyricsService()

# Get lyrics for a track
track_lyrics = lyrics.get_lyrics(
    track_name="Song Name",
    artist="Artist Name"
)

# Save lyrics with track
lyrics.save_lyrics(
    track_path="path/to/track.mp3",
    lyrics=track_lyrics
)

docs.title: Managing Lyrics
docs.text:
# Search lyrics database
results = lyrics.search_lyrics("search term")

# Update lyrics
lyrics.update_lyrics(
    track_id="track_id",
    new_lyrics="updated lyrics"
)

# Export lyrics
lyrics.export_lyrics(
    track_id="track_id",
    format="txt"
)

docs.text:

  • Genius

docs.title: Format Support
docs.text:

docs.title: Batch Processing
docs.text:

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:

docs.title: Adding Playlists to Queue
docs.text:
from motify_music import SpotifyService

# Initialize service
spotify = SpotifyService()

# Get user playlists
playlists = spotify.get_user_playlists()

# Add playlist to download queue
spotify.add_to_queue(playlist_id="your_playlist_id")

docs.title: Managing Download Queue
docs.text:
# Get current queue
queue = spotify.get_download_queue()

# Reorder queue
spotify.reorder_queue(queue_item_id="item_id", new_position=0)

# Remove from queue
spotify.remove_from_queue(queue_item_id="item_id")
